content:
Check:
  any:
    - all:
        - name: ETCD
          operator: is_not_unique_set
          value:
            - ELEMENT
            - TESTRL
            - TEENRL
        - name: TEDUR
          operator: not_exists
    - all:
        - name: ETCD
          operator: is_not_unique_set
          value:
            - ELEMENT
            - TESTRL
            - TEDUR
        - name: TEENRL
          operator: not_exists
    - name: ETCD
      operator: is_not_unique_set
      value:
        - ELEMENT
        - TESTRL
        - TEENRL
        - TEDUR
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SENDIG.216
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: The combination of ELEMENT, TESTRL, TEENRL, and TEDUR must be unique
  for each ETCD.
Outcome:
  Message: The combination of ELEMENT, TESTRL, TEENRL, and TEDUR is not unique for
    each ETCD
  Output Variables:
    - ELEMENT
    - TESTRL
    - TEENRL
    - TEDUR
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Dataset
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SENDIG
        Version: '3.1'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '216'
              Version: '2'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: Elements with different start and end rules are different
                  Elements and must be represented as unique values in ELEMENT and
                  ETCD (i.e., Elements involving the same treatment but different
                  durations are different Elements). The same applies to nontreatment
                  Elements (e.g., a washout with a fixed duration of 14 days is different
                  from a washout that ends after 7 days if drug cannot be detected
                  in a blood sample or after 14 days if drug can be detected in a
                  blood sample). Additional factors beyond treatment, start rule,
                  and either end rule or duration do not distinguish separate Elements.
                Document: IG v3.1
                Section: 7.2.1.1
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - TRIAL DESIGN
  Domains:
    Include:
      - TE

json.Description: The combination of ELEMENT, TESTRL, TEENRL, and TEDUR must be unique for each ETCD.

Outcome.Message: The combination of ELEMENT, TESTRL, TEENRL, and TEDUR is not unique for each ETCD

Citations.Cited_Guidance: Elements with different start and end rules are different Elements and must be represented as unique values in ELEMENT and ETCD (i.e., Elements involving the same treatment but different durations are different Elements). The same applies to nontreatment Elements (e.g., a washout with a fixed duration of 14 days is different from a washout that ends after 7 days if drug cannot be detected in a blood sample or after 14 days if drug can be detected in a blood sample). Additional factors beyond treatment, start rule, and either end rule or duration do not distinguish separate Elements.
